chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Wilkinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/obstructing an officer. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J Wilkinson

records.addlTxt:
11:51 AM 2022TR000877, 2022TR000878, 2022CF000121 - Defendant Kevin J Wilkinson in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper informs the court of the agreement to enter a plea on 22TR877 for 1,050.00, 9 month revocation and 1 yr IID, 22TR878 will be dismissed. 22CF121- count 1 will be amended to an ordinance resisting an officer for 250 plus costs and count 2 will be amended to an ordinance DC for 250 plus costs. 

22TR877 - KW enter a guilty plea. 
Court orders: 1,050.00 total, 9 month revocation, and 1 YR IID upon relicensing.

22TR878 - Dismissed by motion.

22CF121 - Court will amend count one to 79.3 and count 2 will be amended to 79.4.
Count 1 and 2: court orders $250 plus costs on both counts with 60 dtp.

Attorney Harper heard.

1:09 PM Defendant Kevin J Wilkinson in court.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. KW states that he doesn't have an attorney and was told to ask for a court appointed attorney. Court speaks with KW about financials. Court indicates that KW can hire an attorney on his own and should do so before the next hearing.

Court goes over the max penalties. Attorney Harper speaks about having a pretrial conference with KW. Court speaks about the defendant waiving his right to an attorney to receive an offer from Attorney Harper. Court verbally goes over the waiver of an attorney with KW. 

Court set next hearing. Attorney Harper speaks about having the traffic cases track with this cases. 22TR878 and 22TR877 will track with 22CF121. Defendant enters a NG plea in both cases.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on September 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:03 PM Defendant Kevin J Wilkinson appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Harper appears in person. KW doesn't have an attorney.

State heard and asks for a $5,000 signature bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

No objection.

Court orders:
$5,000 signature bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on reasonable demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
